Dear Ms. Patterson:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,

ALLEGATION:
Staff member at facility chats with former youth of the facility via social media, has
smacked more than one youth on the buttocks.
INVESTIGATION:
A complaint was received on 6/14/21 stating there were concerns with Staff 1. The
Referral Source (RS) stated Staff 1 chats with former youth via social media and he
has smacked several youth on the buttocks.
Referral Source Interview: The RS was interviewed via telephone on 6/17/21. He
reported Staff 1 has questionable boundaries with the youth at the facility. Staff 1
slapped a male youth on the buttocks. He reported this information to a supervisor at
the facility, but it never went any further. Staff 1 also hits girls on the buttocks. He
saw this happen with Youth D and another youth whose name he could not recall.
Program Manager (PM) Interview: The PM was interviewed at the facility on
6/24/21. She reported she is Staff 1's supervisor. Staff 1 is a group leader and has a
group of eight youth. He meets with the youth individually, in groups, and with their
family. She stated that Staff 1 is awesome with the kids. He has helped so many of
them. He is familiar with therapeutic treatment and the different types of therapy. He
is able to identify what the youth need. The PM reported she had talked to Staff 1
previously about Staff 1 smacking a youth on the buttocks and jokingly said he
deserved spankings. This conversation was not documented as they do not
document verbal warnings. Yesterday Youth A indicated Staff 1 pretends to choke
them. Youth A told the PM that during group Staff 1 kind of hit Youth A on the
buttocks when she went to walk away. The other girls then reported he pretends to
choke them.PM reported many of the staff buy youth things, including Staff 1. The
Chief Administrator (CA) addresses it with the staff.
3

Youth A Interview: Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 6/24/21. She reported
things are going alright for her. She is frustrated with Staff 1. He is male so it is hard
to open up to him. He also has bad boundaries but does a lot for them. He playfully
hit her on the buttocks with the back of his hand and pretended to choke her. Staff
do not buy them things.
Youth B Interview: Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 6/24/21. Youth B
reported the facility is a good place and the staff treat him well. He has not seen or
heard of any staff touching residents playfully.
Youth C Interview: Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 6/24/21. Youth C
reported Staff 1 is easy to talk to. She has not seen or heard of any of the staff
hitting youth on the buttocks or playfully choking them. She did not have any
concerns with any of the staff.
Staff 2 Interview: Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 6/24/21. Staff 2 works
closely with Staff 1. He does not have any concerns with Staff 1's boundaries. Staff 1
has a good therapeutic relationship with the youth and is a good therapist.
Youth D Interview: Youth D was interviewed at the facility on 6/24/21. She reported
Staff 1 smacked multiple girls on the buttocks with his hand and pickle ball paddles.
He also tries to choke them. Staff 1 smacked her on the buttocks. She was not sure
when this occurred. She was on her way out of group therapy. He had a rolled-up
paper and smacked her on the buttocks with it. He has also done this to several
other girls. He will walk up to the youth and wrap his hands around their neck. She
saw this happen to several other youth. She could not remember what was going on
at the time. A few days ago, Staff 1 smacked Youth A on the buttocks and Youth A
told him to stop. She is not sure why Staff 1 does this to them. Youth D reported she
brought this up to the team in a letter, but she does not think it was addressed and
the letter can no longer be found.
Youth E Interview: Youth E was interviewed at the facility on 6/24/21. Youth E
stated she likes the facility and the bonds she has built with people. She has seen
Staff 1 swat the girls on the buttocks and playfully choke them. She reported Staff 1
grabbed her chin and it triggered her. He will also playfully choke her.
Staff 3 Interview: Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility on 6/24/21. He reported he
does not have any concerns with any of the staff's boundaries.
Staff 1 Interview: Staff 1 was unavailable to be interviewed on 6/24/21 so a Video
Conferencing call was set up for 6/29/21. Staff 1 reported he is a clinician. He does
contact past youth on social media if they are gone more than two years. He
sometimes does this to help the youth out or when a caseworker asks him to reach
out to the youth.
4

Staff 1 reported he did smack one boy on the buttock as it was the youth's birthday.
They talked about the incident, and he apologized for it. It was a trigger for the youth
as he was physically abused at home. Another youth he was horseplaying with, and
he tripped her. The youth went through a door, but she did not fall. He admitted he
does pretend to choke Youth E as they often horseplay. He could not recall doing
these things to any other youth.
The Staff Ethics policy states staff must maintain a professional demeanor with the
youth. Staff must not allow or participate in physical contact such as horseplay,
rough-housing, wrestling, fighting, or other similar activities.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position
assigned.
ANALYSIS: Staff 1 is a clinician and admitted he horseplay’s with the youth
and it was reported by some of the youth that he will smack
them on the buttocks and pretend to choke them. This behavior
indicates Staff 1 does not have the ability and/or the experience
to perform the duties of his position.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
SIR 2021C0102011, CAP approved on 3/31/21
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended no changes
be made to the status of the license of this CCI.
